content.question:
"His commota fugam Dido sociosque parabat.

Conveniunt quibus aut odium crudele tyranni

aut metus acer erat; naves, quae forte paratae,

corripiunt onerantque auro. Portantur avari

5Pygmalionis opes pelago; dux femina facti.

Devenere locos ubi nunc ingentia cernis

moenia surgentemque novae Karthaginis arcem."

Aeneid 1. 360-366

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. In lines 1-4 (His . . . auro), which two Latin words can be translated as “(she) readied her escape”?

2. (A) What case is the adjective crudele (line 2) and (B) which Latin word does it grammatically modify?

3. In lines 1-4 (His . . . auro), (A) identify one perfect passive participle and (B) translate it in context.

4. In this passage, which three Latin words can be translated as “a woman was the leader of enterprise”?

5. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 5 (Pygmalionis . . . facti) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.

6. (A) What is the tense of Devenere (line 6) ? (B) Translate it in context.

7. According to Venus earlier in Book 1, why does Dido fear Pygmalion?
